messages: 6103130184a5cb2706eb422698d9c151 (19:14): i installed the xe version of oracle through a debian package on their website; the main oracle software appears to be running but it does not start on port 8080 as it suggests so i can't access /aepx
6103130184a5cb2706eb422698d9c151 (19:14): i can't find any script to find it
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:18): bnovc: http://localhost:8080/apex gives what? can you telnet to localhost 8080
6103130184a5cb2706eb422698d9c151 (19:22): hali, it gives unable to connect, let met try telnet
6103130184a5cb2706eb422698d9c151 (19:22): telnet: Unable to connect to remote host: Connection refused
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:23): and  ps -ef |grep xe_pmon_XE gives a process?
6103130184a5cb2706eb422698d9c151 (19:25): it asked for a port and password
6103130184a5cb2706eb422698d9c151 (19:26): still can't connect and no process
8462e46bc281be6b36940ecbc0823fc5 (19:29): Is there a way to completely copy a table, including attributes and constraints, in one step?
6103130184a5cb2706eb422698d9c151 (19:29): hali, so apparnetly it just doesn't start?
6103130184a5cb2706eb422698d9c151 (19:30): hali, any suggestions? ican't find any logs about faliures
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:30): bnovc: su - oracle and run dbstart
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:30): bnovc: edit /etc/oratab to have a Y at the end first
6103130184a5cb2706eb422698d9c151 (19:31): nothing found w/locate and no command
37d2de30a27c46d835b1351ae69ab8be (19:31): that would be a big problem as well
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:31): bnovc: you sure you want to use debian?
6103130184a5cb2706eb422698d9c151 (19:31): hali, no i hate debian but i need it on here
37d2de30a27c46d835b1351ae69ab8be (19:32): bnovc: ok that is problem 1 that needs to be solved first
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:32): rizzo: oraenv should set the environment for you
37d2de30a27c46d835b1351ae69ab8be (19:32): bnovc: with 10g you might have to add db_1
37d2de30a27c46d835b1351ae69ab8be (19:33): I don't have any experience with XE though
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:33): bnovc: you sure you are on the right server? ;)
37d2de30a27c46d835b1351ae69ab8be (19:33): bnovc: I believe that 'locate' is only good since the last updatedb.  Have you run updatedb since you installed oracle?
6103130184a5cb2706eb422698d9c151 (19:34): i'm updating db again irght now to make sure
6103130184a5cb2706eb422698d9c151 (19:38): no dbhome on my system from locate
8462e46bc281be6b36940ecbc0823fc5 (19:40): hali: I don't really mean by using exp
8462e46bc281be6b36940ecbc0823fc5 (19:40): I'd rather do a create table as select
8462e46bc281be6b36940ecbc0823fc5 (19:41): I just want to archive the table by copying the data to tablename_someprefix
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:41): misty: not sure if Oracle SQL Developer support 7... you can extract ddl and data through that... or with tora
8462e46bc281be6b36940ecbc0823fc5 (19:41): I want to do it via php
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:41): misty: ah, create table table2 as select * from table1;
8462e46bc281be6b36940ecbc0823fc5 (19:41): but will it copy all the constraints and stuff?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:42): misty: that doesn't copy constraint though.. just structure and data
8462e46bc281be6b36940ecbc0823fc5 (19:42): ok so I need to make my create statement more complex
8462e46bc281be6b36940ecbc0823fc5 (19:42): I can do a create then an insert as
6103130184a5cb2706eb422698d9c151 (19:42): hali, should i manually export ORACLE_HOME to something?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:43): bnovc: export ORACLE_HOME to your oracle dir under /usr/lib
8462e46bc281be6b36940ecbc0823fc5 (19:43): what's a massive task to do?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:43): misty: create the exact create stable statement in 7
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:43): bnovc: in oracle XE it almost always XE
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:44): misty: in later version you have a dbms package to do that
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:44): misty: if you know what kind of constraints you have it's not to bad... but if you want to cater for all possible scenarios it can be a pain
6103130184a5cb2706eb422698d9c151 (19:46): hali, i exported those and ran oracle-xe start again, process still doesn't show up
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:48): bnovc: sqlplus / as sysdba ... and  run startup
6103130184a5cb2706eb422698d9c151 (19:48): ok...should i put ORACLE_HOME and ORACLE_SID in .profile ?

245c9abff05f3f88117059b455fa0242 (19:52): I have a stupid question...  I'm trying to install the sample schema's on oracle 10g after the fact....  according to the docs I can us dbca (but if I click on modify it will not let me click on the samples)

245c9abff05f3f88117059b455fa0242 (19:53): the documentation then talks about a manual install but demos/schema/ does not have the master script and a bunch of the other stuff seems to be missing as well.
245c9abff05f3f88117059b455fa0242 (19:53): is there a simple way to reinstall the sample schema scripts without hosing my database? :)
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:56): now if i just remember the name of the script
245c9abff05f3f88117059b455fa0242 (20:03): actually I was looking for the newer samples hr etc...  that one just does the old stuff right?
245c9abff05f3f88117059b455fa0242 (20:04): actually that one might be the one they want anyway... I'll find out. thanks :)
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (20:04): HR is also available if you want it
245c9abff05f3f88117059b455fa0242 (20:05): I'll do that one first and hopefully be done... if not I'll be back ;)
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (20:05): ok, if you come back i would paste this line ... @?/demo/schema/human_resources/hr_main.sql
6103130184a5cb2706eb422698d9c151 (20:07): hali, other suggestions? shouldn't the startup failure be logged somewhere
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (20:09): possibly.. have a look in /usr/lib/oracle/xe/app/oracle/admin/XE/bdump ... all the trace files and alert_XE.log
